event.title: 2010, the center of population of Florida was located

data.event: In 2010, the center of population of Florida was located in Polk County, near the city of Lake Wales.
One Fortune 500 company – Publix Super Markets (106 in 2012)—has headquarters in the county.
The first people to call Polk County home arrived close to 12,000 years ago during the last ice age as the first paleo-indians following big game southward arrived on the peninsula of Florida.

event.title: times the peninsula was much wider than it is today

data.event: By this time, the peninsula had gone through several expansions and contractions due to changing sea level; at times the peninsula was much wider than it is today, while at other times it was almost entirely submerged with only a few small islands exposed.

event.title: is estimated that there were over 250,000 in 1492

data.event: These Indians thrived on the peninsula and it is estimated that there were over 250,000 in 1492 when Columbus set sail for the New World.

event.title: years, nearly the entire pre-columbian population of Polk County had been wiped out

data.event: Within a few hundred years, nearly the entire pre-columbian population of Polk County had been wiped out.
